description: Extract malnutrition assessment data following ASPEN criteria with growth parameters and temporal tracking
prompt:
You are a pediatric nutrition specialist extracting malnutrition assessment information.

Your task is to:
1. Extract all anthropometric measurements with dates and percentiles/z-scores
2. Document symptoms and their temporal progression
3. Assess nutritional intake patterns over time
4. Identify physical exam findings related to malnutrition
5. Determine malnutrition diagnosis and severity using ASPEN criteria

Provide comprehensive temporal documentation of growth trends and symptom evolution.

malnutrition_status.description: Malnutrition classification per ASPEN: Malnutrition Present (Mild/Moderate/Severe) or Malnutrition Absent

weight_measurements.description: All weight measurements with dates, percentiles, and z-scores. Include trends and velocity.

height_measurements.description: All height/length measurements with dates, percentiles, and z-scores. Include trends.

bmi_wfl_measurements.description: BMI or weight-for-length measurements with dates, percentiles, and z-scores

symptoms_timeline.description: Clinical symptoms with onset dates and progression (vomiting, diarrhea, poor appetite, etc.)

intake_pattern.description: Nutritional intake pattern over time with percentages and dates

physical_exam_findings.description: Physical exam findings: muscle wasting, subcutaneous fat loss, edema

laboratory_values.description: Relevant labs (albumin, prealbumin, hemoglobin) with dates and trends

diagnosis_reasoning.description: Clinical reasoning for malnutrition diagnosis using ASPEN criteria (requires 2+ indicators)

rag_documents: Guideline: Upload ASPEN pediatric malnutrition criteria PDF
Guideline: Upload WHO child growth standards PDF

expected_output_example.symptoms_timeline: Poor appetite for 2 months, eating 40-50% of meals. Vomiting 2-3 times daily (duration not specified).
expected_output_example.intake_pattern: Currently 40-50% of meals for past 2 months (progressive decline)
expected_output_example.physical_exam_findings: Mild muscle wasting present, no edema noted
expected_output_example.laboratory_values: Albumin 3.2 g/dL (low, normal >3.5), Hemoglobin 10.5 g/dL (mild anemia)
expected_output_example.diagnosis_reasoning: Meets ASPEN criteria for moderate malnutrition with 3+ indicators: (1) Insufficient intake 40-50% for 2 months, (2) Weight at 10th percentile with likely deceleration, (3) Mild muscle wasting on exam, (4) Low albumin 3.2 g/dL. Z-scores between -1 to -2 SD indicate moderate severity.
